intro: Hinterhubera berengariana, commonly known as the Berengarian orchid, is a rare and striking species native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its intricate, showy flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, preferring well-drained soil and high humidity. Its botanical features include a sympodial growth habit and specialized roots that aid in nutrient absorption. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
